column4: when i run ddrescue to rescue my disk it starts working, updates some numbers like access rate but stops updating after 20 seconds and the disk makes scratchy noises again for like 30 seconds, then it is silent and nothing happens for hours
what can i do?
sounds like a HW problem, probably fried HDD
yes but ddrescue shuold rescue exactly that
no, not really :)
it should just jump over fried sectors
it says so in the doc
not if the HDD is physically damaaged
yes exactly for physically damaged disks it is meant
thats the entire idea of ddrescue
call me a naysayer if you wish, but I think you put too much faith into that :)
did you ever read the ddrescue doc? http://www.gnu.org/software/ddrescue/ddrescue.html
yes it can rescue parts of it, thats what ddrescue is meant for.
a HDD is a mechanical device, if there is something mechanically wrong with it, its dead, unless you ship it off to some fancy HDD rescue shop who will take it apart and fix it for you manually
not correct
there are many different hardware errors, most partially fixable
no, it usually means head failure and bad sectors, which ddrescue is meant for to deal with
okay, well why dont you just use it then? :)
the problem is it stops working after some time
maybe because it cant read from the disk AT ALL?
it can read from the disk, it works for 20 seconds
do that then...
no thats the last resort and only necessary if the device is not recognized by the bios due to sticking heads
